snippet: President Obama is trying to figure out what form a residual force might take after the bulk of American troops leave, or what would happen if no Americans stayed behind.
abstract: Pres Obama meets with his top Afghanistan commanders to determine what form of residual force may take there after American troops leave, as well as what may occur if no Americans stay behind at all; administration officials say internal dynamics are complicating important decision, while Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai's unreliability at same increases difficulties.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Washington, and Azam Ahmed from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: President Obama is trying to figure out what form a residual force might take after the bulk of American troops leave, or what would happen if no Americans stayed behind.

headline.main: Old Tensions Resurface in Debate Over U.S. Role in Post-2014 Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Old Tensions Resurface in Debate Over U.S. Role in Post-2014 Afghanistan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
